Package serverside.clienthandler

Interface ClientHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClientHandlerMethod
    public interface ClientHandler
    The client handler responsible for handling the messages sent by the client and sending messages to the client when not in a game of Pentago but connected to the Server. Whenever a client connects to the server a new clientHandler object is created for the client. Once a game has started the GameHandler then handles the messages until the game is over.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void close()
      This method used to exit and stop the client handler.
      java.lang.String getClientName()
      The method is used to access the client's client name.
      java.io.PipedReader getGameIn()
      The method is used to access the PipedReader used by the clientHandler.
      boolean getInGame()
      This method is used to access the boolean getInGame which indicates if a clientHandler is in a game or not.
      java.io.PrintWriter getOut()
      The method is used to access the PrintWriter used by the clientHandler.
      java.lang.String getUsername()
      The method is used to access the client's username.
      void sendToClient​(java.lang.String message)
      This method is used to send a message to the client using the printWriter.
      void setInGame​(boolean bool)
      This method is used to modify the inGame boolean which indicates if a client is in the game or not.

    • Method Detail

      • getGameIn

        java.io.PipedReader getGameIn()
        The method is used to access the PipedReader used by the clientHandler.
        Returns:
        the PipedReader used by the clientHandler to read incoming data from the client

      • getOut

        java.io.PrintWriter getOut()
        The method is used to access the PrintWriter used by the clientHandler.
        Returns:
        the PrintWriter used by the clientHandler to send data to the client.

      • getClientName

        java.lang.String getClientName()
        The method is used to access the client's client name.
        Returns:
        the String which contains the client's client name.

      • getUsername

        java.lang.String getUsername()
        The method is used to access the client's username.
        Returns:
        the String which contains the client's username.

      • sendToClient

        void sendToClient​(java.lang.String message)
        This method is used to send a message to the client using the printWriter.
        Parameters:
        message - the String to be sent to the client.

      • getInGame

        boolean getInGame()
        This method is used to access the boolean getInGame which indicates if a clientHandler is in a game or not.
        Returns:
        the true if the client is in a game and false otherwise.

      • setInGame

        void setInGame​(boolean bool)
        This method is used to modify the inGame boolean which indicates if a client is in the game or not.
        Parameters:
        bool - which is a boolean and can be either true or false depending on whether the client is in a game.

      • close

        void close()
        This method used to exit and stop the client handler. It closes all the readers and writers and also closes the socket used by the client handler to end the connection with the server.
